subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Mappings of the Read Alphabet to IPA and to various non-English languages
msgSnippet: ... Yup. Works best with a decent browser (IE9+, Firefox, Chrome, Safari): http://adiabatic.github.com/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet/ ... Speakers of
messageBody:
On Apr 4, 2012, at 11:19 AM, Mark Atwood <me@...> wrote:

 

Has anyone created a working mapping between the Read Alphabet and IPA?

Yup. Works best with a decent browser (IE9+, Firefox, Chrome, Safari):

http://adiabatic.github.com/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet/

And various non-English languages have a much closer association
between the written and spoken languages, such as Spanish. And
various others have much more straightforward vowels, such as
Japanese.

Has anyone done any work on mapping the Read Alphabet onto those languages?

..m

Speakers of per languages would best be served trying to make their own 'optimized' orthographies in the style of QS rather than simply trying to cargo-cult Shaw's and Read's work, IMO.
